results.snippet: Since a word’s meaning is constituted by its (basic) underived acceptance property, this decision endows the word with a meaning. results.title: Denis McManus, Boghossian, Miller and Lewis on dispositional theories of meaning
results.snippet: Paul Boghossian has pointed out a ’circularity problem’ for dispositionalist theories of meaning: as a result of the holistic character of belief fixation, one cannot identify someone’s meaning such and such with facts of the form S is disposed to utter P under conditions C, without C involving the semantic and intentional notions that such a theory was to explain.
